alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 03 at 6:21PM PDT until June 03 at 7:45PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Fresno County in central California... North Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 745 PM PDT. * At 621 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall rates of 0.5 inches an hour is possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roaring River Ranger Station, Pear Lake Ranger Station, Marble Fork Kaweah, Mitchell Meadow, Bearpaw Ranger Station, Moraine Campground, Canyon View Campground, Sentinel Campground, Cedar Grove and Sheep Creek Campground. This includes the following streams and drainages... Middle Fork Kaweah River, Lewis Creek, Ferguson Creek, Lone Pine Creek, Lightning Creek, Granite Creek, Roaring River, Big Arroyo, Boulder Creek, Cabin Creek, Sphinx Creek, Cunningham Creek, Kern River, Silliman Creek, Buck Creek, South Fork Kings River, Marble Fork Kaweah River, Stony Creek, Sheep Creek, East Creek, Sugarloaf Creek, Cliff Creek, Brewer Creek and Moraine Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
